summary: This document appears to be a collection of investigative records, primarily consisting of call detail logs from a MetroPCS phone number (16980) for the period January 1, 2006, to August 1, 2006. It also references administrative subpoena results from Cingular, Sprint/Nextel, and JetBlue related to Jeffrey Epstein and associates, as part of a case identified as 31E-MM-108062. This document is a segment of a MetroPCS call detail record for phone number 16980, covering pages 13-25 of 125. It lists hundreds of billed phone calls with timestamps, dialed numbers, and call durations from February 18, 2006, to March 17, 2006. The document appears to be a forensic record of telephone activity, likely subpoenaed as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's network. This document is a call detail record from MetroPCS for a specific phone number (16980), covering the period from January 1, 2006, to August 1, 2006. It logs numerous phone calls with timestamps, durations, and technical call data, but contains no named individuals, narrative content, or specific events related to the Epstein case.
